item.description:
Click this link before you do anything else -

http://charismamystery.eventbrite.com/

Admission is free thanks to the generosity of the Lowell Institute

(the last lecture was awesome so this one should be even more betterer)

I'll be near the Membership booth at 6:00 so join me there so that we can sit together if you're so inclined.

You only get one chance to make a positive first impression. The people you meet assess your competence, trustworthiness, and intelligence within a matter of seconds. What makes a person magnetic and able to attract others so naturally? Is charisma genetically based? Can it be cultivated? Boost your power to make a fantastic first impression through the science of charisma and gain the tools to succeed when interviewing for a job, meeting a blind date, or running for president.

Museum of Science
With Olivia Fox Cabane, author of The Charisma Myth: How Anyone Can Master the Art and Science of Personal Magnetism; Alex "Sandy" Pentland, PhD, Toshiba Professor of Media, Arts, and Sciences, and director of the Human Dynamics Lab at MIT.

SPONSORED BY:

 

Here's a link to a description of the Lowell Institute in case anyone else is wondering who they are and why they are so generous: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lowell_Institute
item.name: THE CHARISMA MYSTERY (register with Eventbrite link below)
